channel.title: Major budget pc?
channel.description:
My uses for it will revolve around pirated Win7 (or using the key from an old laptop), and a kubuntu/lubuntu dual boot. The only things I'll really be doing is Minecraft (alongside a screen recorder, ex: Fraps), and basic programming in Java, nothing too hardcore. The problem is I know that Minecraft is very CPU and GPU dependent. My budget is very slim (around $400) and I already have an old 1440x900 monitor (DVI), and a mouse/keyboard. I only need a tower to build that will (hopefully) hold 60+ fps while recording in minecraft.
Im on pcpartpicker.com trying to build one but I keep comming up short of keeping it within budget. The only reason I am asking is because I am a software person, I know very little about hardware.
tl;dr - Im needing help building a $400 desktop tower that will easily hold 60+ fps while screen recording on minecraft. Should be able to run Win7 and Ubuntu dualboot as well. Would help if it is all overclockable, I can upgrade the cooling system as needed.

item.title: Major budget pc?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

No. Minecraft has horrible rendering, it’s very poorly optimized with or without a graphics card. It should be runnable without one; however, because of the poor optimizations (or lack thereof), a graphics card is required.

Read full topic

item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

eyeownyew:

Minecraft’s rendering is horribly done, though; he’d still hit performance issues without a graphics card

what do you mean? i know it realizes utilizes your graphic card memory when you like have a large viewpoint or have like thousands of tnts and explode em
and do you mean with a graphics card?

Read full topic

item.title: Major budget pc?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Building a PC really isn’t hard at all. I just built my very first one for ~$350 and it took me about 4 hours including installation of Windows 7. It just takes time and patience. Troubleshooting hardware shouldn’t be too much of a problem given you spend a little time doing some research i.e internet, manuals.

http://www.amazon.com/FX-Socket-GeForce-Motherboard-N68C-GS/dp/B0083B6HEQ/ $45 MicroATX Motherboard
http://www.amazon.com/AMD-Athlon-Dual-Core-Desktop-Processor/dp/B005AKK02S/ $60 3.4GHz Dual Core
http://www.amazon.com/Kingston-Technology-1333MHz-KHX1333C9D3B1K2-8G/dp/B004DDI0IE/ $64 8GB DDR3 1600MHz RAM
http://www.amazon.com/Rosewill-MicroATX-Tower-Computer-FBM-01/dp/B005LIDU5S/ $26 MicroATX Case (Tight fit, but best bang for buck)
http://www.amazon.com/WD-Blue-Desktop-Hard-Drive/dp/B0088PUEPK/ $65 1TB SATA III HDD
http://www.amazon.com/Lite--Super-AllWrite-Layer-Drive/dp/B002YIG9AQ/ $21 24X SATA DVD+/-RW Dual Layer Drive
http://www.amazon.com/Sapphire-Radeon-PCI-Express-Graphics-100323-2L/dp/B0086ZV2L2/ $50 1GB DDR3 Graphics
http://www.amazon.com/Corsair-Builder-Watt-EPS-CX600/dp/B0092ML0OC/ $58 600W PSU 80PLUS (Energy efficient at 80% load; Corsair is quality)

http://www.amazon.com/Innovation-Cooling-Diamond-Thermal-Compound/dp/B0042IEVD8/ $7 Thermal Compound (Compare to AS5)

Highest temps with this build is at 45 Celsius which is the GPU, and this is when playing games such as Dishonored on medium-high settings.

Total: ~$400-415 with free shipping

You could substitute the $50 GPU and $60 CPU without sacrificing much while saving maybe a good $30.

I’ve been using the above set-up for a few months now. It’s super quiet, fast, and reliable. The lowest rating is a 5.9 which is the graphics card. I can play Minecraft on the max settings and still get a great FPS rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Major budget pc?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I have to :palm: at everyone here sorry. Coon stated he is a hardware nub so I am assuming he doesn’t have the experience/never built a computer before. If somebody posts a prebuilt build obviously there will be faults compared to building one. This was purely a build for him to give an other option if he was not wanting to actually build it. For 500$ that’s about as good as you are going to get on a prebuilt machine.

Even though as well you really have to check the site on a weekly basis. They do get some decent deals. I have seen machines such as that go down to 350$ at times.

Read full topic

item.title: Major budget pc?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:25, topic:530252”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=649011.msg4363382#msg4363382 date=1379189340]I’d rather lul at you than explain to you ;x.
[/quote]

[quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=649011.msg4363382#msg4363382 date=1379189340]I’ve just lolwat’ed them.
[/quote]
er, both of those are ignorance. You are being ignorant. Thank you for proving my point
You also should not ever even hit 80% memory usage if you’re safe.

It should never even be close to 95%. Even if you hit it once, that is a serious sign that you need an upgrade.

If you manage to run out of memory with Windows 7, the entire OS becomes unusable and your system will crash without backing up any data. It’s a good idea to stay on the safe side and prevent this from happening.

With eclipse + Skype open I idle at roughly 80%

You… have < 1GB ram?[/quote]

4 total, 3.49 GB usable. Dual core AMD E-300 APU with Radeon HD gfx @ 1.30 GHz

@Kidpaparoach wrote:

eyeownyew:

Gaming? If you’re playing a game or doing 3d modeling and you run out of memory, your computer is going to crash and you’re going to lose everything. Stop being so ignorant.

Lul. Wut, I’m not going to get a hardware failure; I still don’t know why you think you know enough to claim that I will o.o. Well good sir, thanks for your concern but my desktop is fine.
I’m not being ignorant in the slightest FYI, I’m just lulling at your ignorance ;o; I’m not interested in explaining things to you. I’d rather lul at you than explain to you ;x.
I haven’t given you any insight in regards to my system (except 3gb of ram), your just making assumptions and I haven’t corrected you at all - I’ve just lolwat’ed them.

So this isn’t a spam post -
@op
I’d just like to say you can get some nice second hand gfx cards if you want to cut costs as much as you.
